subject: Music
title: Minimalism: Less Is More
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Minimalism: Less Is More.

hook.text: Minimalist composers repeat tiny patterns for hours â€” and somehow it's hypnotic, not boring.

buildup.text: Steve Reich, Philip Glass, and Terry Riley stripped music down to its bare essentials.

discovery.text: Reich's Music for 18 Musicians builds complex textures from simple repeating patterns.

twist.text: Classical critics hated it. Audiences and filmmakers loved it.

climax.text: Minimalism influenced electronic music, film scores, and ambient music for decades.

punchline.text: Repeat something enough and it stops being simple. It becomes infinite.

quiz.question: What defines minimalist classical music?
options: Repetitive patterns that gradually evolve to create complex textures
